meanings.definition: The end or extremity of something.
meanings.sent1: The dog wagged its tail with excitement, hitting my butt.
meanings.sent2: I sat on the cold ground, feeling the hard butt beneath me.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally closed the door on my butt, ouch!
meanings.sent4: The sun set behind the mountains, painting the sky in shades of pink and orange like a giant butt.
meanings.sent5: The ship sailed towards the horizon, disappearing behind the butt of the ocean.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is the object of ridicule or criticism.
meanings.sent1: The poor squirrel became the butt of all jokes in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The politician's controversial decision made him the butt of criticism from the public.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy clown tripped over his own feet, becoming the butt of his own jokes.
meanings.sent4: The old car, with its rusted exterior, was the butt of everyone's laughter.
meanings.sent5: The student's misspelled poster became the butt of teasing from classmates.

meanings.definition: To strike or push with the head or horns.
meanings.sent1: The goat tried to butt the farmer out of the way.
meanings.sent2: The ram butted against the fence, trying to escape from the pen.
meanings.sent3: The toddler playfully butted his head against his father's chest.
meanings.sent4: The boxer butted his opponent in the ring, earning a penalty.
meanings.sent5: The sheep butted the gate open, eager to explore the greener pastures beyond.
